Key Match Events: Tyrese Maxey scored the go-ahead basket with 23.7 seconds left to give the Philadelphia 76ers a 109-103 win over the Washington Wizards.
Guerschon Yabusele scored 21 points and blocked a potential tying layup with 14 seconds left to preserve the win for the Sixers.
Bilal Coulibaly helped Washington rally from a 16-point hole and stretched the lead to 101-98 on a jumper.
Pre-Game Insights: With so many key starters out and both teams well under.500, there was a preseason vibe at the Wells Fargo Center until the Wizards made a serious run in the fourth.
Joel Embiid, Paul George, Kyle Lowry, and Andre Drummond all sat out for Philadelphia while Washington played without leading scorer Jordan Poole and Malcolm Brogdon.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Wizards: The Wizards have lost four straight games and six of seven. They have the worst record in the NBA at 6-29.
76ers: Tickets on the secondary market were going for less than $10 each in the lower 100 level right before tipoff.
Others: Takeaways: Eric Gordon hit the tying 3 for the Sixers.
Jared Butler scored 26 points for the Wizards and Corey Kispert had 23.
